soc.game

Class SOCDevCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCInventoryItem
      • soc.game.SOCDevCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, SOCDevCardConstants

    public class SOCDevCard
extends SOCInventoryItem
implements SOCDevCardConstants
    A single Development Card, probably within a player's SOCInventory.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Is this card type a Victory Point card?
        Parameters:
        devCardType - A constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS
        Returns:
        True for VP card types, false otherwise
        See Also:
        SOCInventoryItem.isVPItem()

      • getCardTypeNameKey

        public static java.lang.String getCardTypeNameKey(int devCardType,
                                                  SOCGame game,
                                                  boolean withArticle)
        Get a card type's name key for I18N localization.
        Parameters:
        devCardType - A constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS
        game - Game data, or null; some game options might change a card name. For example, _SC_PIRI renames "Knight" to "Warship".
        withArticle - If true, format is: "a Market (+1VP)"; if false, is "Market (1VP)"
        Returns:
        The card name key for ctype and withArticle; unknown ctypes return "spec.dcards.unknown" / "spec.dcards.aunknown".
        See Also:
        getCardTypeName(int, SOCGame, boolean, SOCStringManager)

      • getCardTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getCardTypeName(int devCardType,
                                               SOCGame game,
                                               boolean withArticle,
                                               SOCStringManager strings)
        Get a card type's localized name.

        For the card type's unique technical name (like SOCDevCardConstants fields), call getCardTypeName(int) instead.

        Parameters:
        devCardType - A constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS
        game - Game data, or null; some game options might change a card name. For example, _SC_PIRI renames "Knight" to "Warship".
        withArticle - If true, format is: "a Market (+1VP)"; if false, is "Market (1VP)"
        strings - StringManager to get i18n localized text
        Returns:
        The localized card name, formatted per ctype and withArticle; unknown ctypes return "Unknown card type #"
        See Also:
        getCardTypeNameKey(int, SOCGame, boolean)

      • getCardTypeName

        public static java.lang.String getCardTypeName(int devCardType)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get a card's unique technical name, which is similar to SOCDevCardConstants field names like SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS.

        For the card type's localized name to display to the user, call getCardTypeName(int, SOCGame, boolean, SOCStringManager) instead.

        The names are generally the same as those in SOCDevCardConstants as of v2.4.00. SOCDevCardConstants.TEMPLE has always been returned from here as "TEMPLE", although before v2.4.50 it was declared in the code as SOCDevCardConstants.TEMP, so it won't possibly be viewed as "TEMPORARY".

        Parameters:
        devCardType - A constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS
        Returns:
        Dev card type's unique technical name, all-uppercase and following the pattern [A-Z][A-Z0-9_]+, or Integer.toString(devCardType) if not a recognized type constant
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if devCardType < 0
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getCardType(String)

      • getCardType

        public static int getCardType(java.lang.String ctypeName)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Given a card type's unique technical name like "ROADS", return its card type constant like SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS if recognized.
        Parameters:
        ctypeName - Dev card type's technical name, as returned by getCardTypeName(int), or a numeric string like "42" for any recognized or unrecognized type's numeric value
        Returns:
        That type's constant such as SOCDevCardConstants.UNIV or SOCDevCardConstants.ROADS if recognized, or its parsed value if starts with a digit, or 0 if type string is unrecognized.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ctypeName is null or "", or doesn't start with an uppercase 'A'-'Z' or digit '0'-'9'
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if ctypeName starts with a digit but Integer.parseInt(String) fails
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        getCardTypeName(int)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a human-readable description, including type, isPlayable, isVP.

        Returns:

        Since:

      • getItemName

        public java.lang.String getItemName(SOCGame game,
                                    boolean withArticle,
                                    SOCStringManager strings)
        Description copied from class: SOCInventoryItem
        Get the item's name.

        Called at server and at client, so any i18n name keys used must be in properties files at server and client.

        SOCInventoryItem's implementation just calls strings.get(key) with the string keys passed to the constructor: SOCInventoryItem.strKey, SOCInventoryItem.aStrKey. If you need something more dynamic, override this in your subclass.

        Overrides:
        getItemName in class SOCInventoryItem
        Parameters:
        game - Game data, or null; some game options might change an item name. For example, _SC_PIRI renames "Knight" to "Warship".
        withArticle - If true, format is: "a Market (+1VP)"; if false, is "Market (1VP)"
        strings - StringManager to get i18n localized text
        Returns:
        The localized item name, formatted per withArticle
